CodeList.Name: Acute Coronary Syndrome Presentation Category

Description.TranslatedText: A classification of the presentation of acute coronary syndrome.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A myocardial infarction that does not produce elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Non-ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)
A myocardial infarction that produces elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Angina pectoris which has not recently changed in frequency, duration or intensity. Stable angina pectoris is relieved by rest or administration of oral, sublingual or transdermal antianginal medications.
Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Acute Coronary Syndrome Presentation Category Terminology
